description.narrative: To support efforts of Development Research Communication and Services Centre to improve the quality of life and livelihoods of rural women through capacity building and awareness raising activities in West Bengal. In particular project activities will include capacity building workshops for 20 existing women groups in 2 villages. Each group will consist of 10-12 households, special emphasis will be given to women headed households. About 150 Nutrition gardens will be developed for participating families; each garden will have 6 different types of vegetables, and the waste generated in the entire household will be recycled. Participants will be trained how to gather and store rainwater; how to implement gardening techniques such as raised beds and frames, floating and raised nurseries (especially useful in case of flooding). 2 seed banks on a raised platform will be created. In addition there will be basic literacy workshops for women and young girls and workshops raising awareness on balanced nutrition, disaster preparedness and local biodiversity conservation
